body:
$! Under data protection law, anyone can ask if your business holds personal information about them - you must respond to their request within 40 days. $!

You can charge them up to £10 to provide the information.

They have the right to know:

- what information is being used
- why it's being used
- where it came from
- who can see the information

You must send them a hard copy, if possible - like a letter or print out - unless you both agree otherwise.

Make sure they can understand the information - eg explain what any codes mean.

%If you ignore the request or don't provide the information, you could be given a heavy fine by the Information Commissioner's Office.%
overview: Responding to a data protection request - what you need to provide, how much you can charge, and what happens if you don't provide the information.
title: Respond to a data protection request
